intro: Bartlettina conspicua, commonly known as the showy bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological importance. Bartlettina conspicua is often found in rich, loamy soils and thrives in environments with partial to full shade.
